main event: A pilot of BOAC airlines observed a long streak in the sky over the Atlantic Ocean on November 11, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed traveling from East to West at a very high speed,The altitude of the object was estimated to be about 50,000 feet from the observing aircraft,The sighting was categorized as an astronomical phenomenon, specifically a meteor,There was no physical evidence or photographs present with the report,The duration of the observation was not reported.
location: Atlantic Ocean, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
